channel.title: NDTV News Search Records Found 1000
channel.description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

item.title: PM Thanks Mexico's President For Support In India's Fight Agains Terrorism

media:content.media:description: This was the first meeting between PM Modi and Mexico's President Claudia Sheinbaum Pardo.

item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has met Mexico's President Claudia Sheinbaum Pardo and thanked her for the support extended by her country to India in its fight against terrorism.
item.content:encoded: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has met Mexico's President Claudia Sheinbaum Pardo and thanked her for the support extended by her country to India in its fight against terrorism.

item.title: US To Shut Embassy In Jerusalem For 3 Days As Israel-Iran War Intensifies

media:content.media:description: The US Embassy in Jerusalem will be shut from Wednesday through Friday, it said.

item.description: The U.S. Embassy in Jerusalem will be shut from Wednesday through Friday due to the security situation in the region and to comply with Israeli guidance, the U.S. State Department said on Tuesday.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. Embassy in Jerusalem will be shut from Wednesday through Friday due to the security situation in the region and to comply with Israeli guidance, the U.S. State Department said on Tuesday.

item.title: Trump To Extend TikTok Sale Deadline For Third Time

media:content.media:description: Trump will sign an additional executive order this week to keep TikTok running, The White House said.

item.description: US President Donald Trump will extend a June 19 deadline for China-based ByteDance to divest the U.S. assets of short video app TikTok by 90 days despite a law that had mandated a sale or a shutdown absent significant progress.
item.content:encoded: US President Donald Trump will extend a June 19 deadline for China-based ByteDance to divest the U.S. assets of short video app TikTok by 90 days despite a law that had mandated a sale or a shutdown absent significant progress.

item.title: PM Modi Meets Canadian PM, Calls India-Canada Ties "Extremely Important"

media:content.media:description: This was the first meeting between the two leaders since Carney assumed office in May 2025.

item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said relations between India and Canada are "extremely important" as he held talks with his Canadian counterpart Mark Carney on the margins of the G7 Summit here.
item.content:encoded: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said relations between India and Canada are "extremely important" as he held talks with his Canadian counterpart Mark Carney on the margins of the G7 Summit here.

item.title: G7 Summit - "India-Canada Ties Extremely Important": PM Modi Meets Mark Carney

media:content.media:description: The G7 invite to PM Modi is seen to have signalled Canada's intent to get ties with India back on track.

item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met his Canadian counterpart Mark Carney on the sidelines of the G7 meet in Alberta today. Their bilateral meet carries the hope of a reboot in ties since they deteriorated last year under Justin Trudeau.
item.content:encoded: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met his Canadian counterpart Mark Carney on the sidelines of the G7 meet in Alberta today. Their bilateral meet carries the hope of a reboot in ties since they deteriorated last year under Justin Trudeau.

item.title: Live Updates: PM Modi Meets Canada's Mark Carney On Sidelines Of G7 Summit

media:content.media:description: Canadian PM Mark Carney welcomed Prime Minister Narendra Modi for the G7 Summit in Canada

item.description: PM Modi is in Canada to attend the annual G7 Summit. He said he would be discussing important global issues and highlight the issues of the Global South at the international forum.
item.content:encoded: PM Modi is in Canada to attend the annual G7 Summit. He said he would be discussing important global issues and highlight the issues of the Global South at the international forum.

item.title: PM Meets German Chancellor, Discusses Ways To Strengthen Bilateral Ties

media:content.media:description: PM Modi on Tuesday met German Chancellor Friedrich Merz on the sidelines of G7 Summit in Canada.

item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday met German Chancellor Friedrich Merz and discussed ways to strengthen bilateral cooperation in key areas such as trade and investment, defence and security, green energy and technology.
item.content:encoded: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday met German Chancellor Friedrich Merz and discussed ways to strengthen bilateral cooperation in key areas such as trade and investment, defence and security, green energy and technology.

item.title: France To Hold Next G7 Summit In Evian Spa Town

media:content.media:description: Next year's summit of the Group of Seven powers will take place in Evian, Macron said.

item.description: Next year's summit of the Group of Seven powers will take place in Evian, the French spa town known for its eponymous mineral water, President Emmanuel Macron announced Tuesday.
item.content:encoded: Next year's summit of the Group of Seven powers will take place in Evian, the French spa town known for its eponymous mineral water, President Emmanuel Macron announced Tuesday.

item.title: Israel-Iran Attacks LIVE: "Unconditional Surrender," Trump Warns Iran Through Social Media Posts

media:content.media:description: Israel's strikes have killed at least 224 people in Iran

item.description: Israel-Iran Attacks LIVE Updates:The deadly conflict between Iran and Israel entered its fifth day on Tuesday, with both sides widening their attacks.
item.content:encoded: Israel-Iran Attacks LIVE Updates:The deadly conflict between Iran and Israel entered its fifth day on Tuesday, with both sides widening their attacks.

item.title: PM Modi Meets With World Leaders On Sidelines Of G7 Summit In Canada

media:content.media:description: PM Modi also met with his Australian counterpart Anthony Albanese on sidelines of G7 Summit.

item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday met with the leaders of South Korea, Mexico, South Africa and Australia on the sidelines of the G7 Summit here.
item.content:encoded: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday met with the leaders of South Korea, Mexico, South Africa and Australia on the sidelines of the G7 Summit here.

item.title: Paris Museum Housing 'Mona Lisa' Closes As Staff Protest Tourist Overcrowding

media:content.media:description: The Louvre museum is home to the Mona Lisa and other iconic works of art in Paris.

item.description: The Louvre, home to the Mona Lisa, closed abruptly Monday as the museum's staff staged an impromptu strike over large crowds of tourists and understaffing.
item.content:encoded: The Louvre, home to the Mona Lisa, closed abruptly Monday as the museum's staff staged an impromptu strike over large crowds of tourists and understaffing.

item.title: US Moving Fighter Jets To Middle East As Israel-Iran War Rages
item.description: The US military is deploying more fighter aircraft to the Middle East and extending the deployment of other warplanes, three US officials said.
item.content:encoded: The US military is deploying more fighter aircraft to the Middle East and extending the deployment of other warplanes, three US officials said.

item.title: Indian Students In Iran Being Taken To Armenia For Return: Omar Abdullah
item.description: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Tuesday said students from the union territory studying in Iran are being taken to Armenia from where they would be brought home.
item.content:encoded: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Tuesday said students from the union territory studying in Iran are being taken to Armenia from where they would be brought home.

item.title: Suspected Israeli Hackers Claim To Destroy Data At Iran's Bank Sepah
item.description: An anti-Iranian government hacking group with potential ties to Israel and a track record of destructive cyberattacks on Iran claimed in social media posts that it had destroyed data at Iran's state-owned Bank Sepah.
item.content:encoded: An anti-Iranian government hacking group with potential ties to Israel and a track record of destructive cyberattacks on Iran claimed in social media posts that it had destroyed data at Iran's state-owned Bank Sepah.

item.title: Regime Change In Iran May Give Rise To A More Threatening Force, Not Democracy

media:content.media:description: Netanyahu has made his goal clear: conflict "could certainly" lead to regime change in Iran

item.description: The timing and targets of Israels attacks on Iran tell us that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahus short-term goal is to damage Irans nuclear facilities in order to severely diminish its weapons program.
item.content:encoded: The timing and targets of Israels attacks on Iran tell us that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahus short-term goal is to damage Irans nuclear facilities in order to severely diminish its weapons program.

item.title: 'Overvoltage' Caused April Blackout, Spain Says

media:content.media:description: A major power outage that paralysed the Iberian Peninsula in April was caused by "overvoltage"

item.description: The blackout had "multiple" causes, Ecological Transition Minister Sara Aagesen told reporters, adding the system "lacked sufficient voltage control capacity" that day.
item.content:encoded: The blackout had "multiple" causes, Ecological Transition Minister Sara Aagesen told reporters, adding the system "lacked sufficient voltage control capacity" that day.

item.title: Honda Succeeds In Reusable Rocket Test, Aims At 2029 For Spaceflight

media:content.media:description: Honda succeeded in a launch and landing test of its prototype reusable rocket

item.description: Honda R&D, the research arm of Japan's second-biggest carmaker, successfully landed its 6.3-metre (20.6-foot) experimental reusable launch vehicle after reaching an altitude of 271 metres (889 feet) at its test facility in Taiki.
item.content:encoded: Honda R&D, the research arm of Japan's second-biggest carmaker, successfully landed its 6.3-metre (20.6-foot) experimental reusable launch vehicle after reaching an altitude of 271 metres (889 feet) at its test facility in Taiki.

item.title: "Unconditional Surrender," Trump Warns Iran Through Social Media Posts

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump said that, "for now" he would not eliminate Iran's Supreme Leader

item.description: The only reason they are choosing to not do it is to avoid any retaliation against American civilians and troops. He also demanded for an "Unconditional surrender".

He also demanded for an "Unconditional surrender".

item.title: China's Xi Jinping Signs Treaty To Elevate Ties With Central Asia

media:content.media:description: China President Xi Jinping signed a treaty to elevate ties with Central Asian nations on Tuesday

item.description: China President Xi Jinping signed a treaty to elevate ties with Central Asian nations on Tuesday, as Beijing looks to further deepen cooperation on trade, energy and infrastructure with the resource-rich region.
item.content:encoded: China President Xi Jinping signed a treaty to elevate ties with Central Asian nations on Tuesday, as Beijing looks to further deepen cooperation on trade, energy and infrastructure with the resource-rich region.

item.title: "Not Racism, Just Facts": British-Pakistanis Call For Honest Dialogue On Grooming Gangs Report

media:content.media:description: The report found evidence of "over-representation" of Pakistani heritage men among suspects.

item.description: The Baroness Casey report reveals institutional failures in addressing child sexual exploitation, particularly involving grooming gangs with a disproportionate number of Pakistani-heritage men.
item.content:encoded: The Baroness Casey report reveals institutional failures in addressing child sexual exploitation, particularly involving grooming gangs with a disproportionate number of Pakistani-heritage men.
